column5: Thanks guys. Glad yas enjoyed that. Ti'll next time.
went there about 15 years ago, the Tree River to die for! I got a 23lb Char, they are azz-kickers to catch! Watche the Inuits skin a bear at 2 am one night too!
Not pike or walleye... instead char and lake trout, but had a great trip and thought I'd share it.http://ontariofishingcommunity.com/f...howtopic=56276

Bunk, I don't know you or what you do for a living, but you have a flair for writing. I was glued to my computer screen until midnight. Hopefully some magazine mogul will see your report and pay you to do that. How bad would that be? Best to you and your sidekick. Never ever leave that woman!
Thank you for sharing your experience, the pictures are amazing. A trip of a life time.
Great story and photos...makes me want to go there now. Juls
That was nothing less than absolutely amazing.
Amazing photos, that looks like an incredible trip. Thanks for sharing.
Moosebunk has done several equally outstanding reports. A little searching should bring them up for you. They are worth saving and checking out during the slow season.
Your flair for writing/story telling is what helped you win the trip. Thanks for trip down memory lane. The tree is truly an awesome palce. Excellent photos too.
